results.title: What happens when you're sick?
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Michael Heldman
results.brief_description: Shows why we experience symptoms such as fever, sneezing, upset stomach and diarrhoea when we’re sick and symptoms such as bleeding, swelling, and pain when we’re injured.

results.title: What happens inside?
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to record growth of a fertilised mammal egg. The terms gestation, umbilicus and placenta are explained. Shows birth of a litter of kittens and compares mother’s care of kittens to that of humans. Describes the first four months of human foetal development. From the series “Family living and sex eduation”.

results.title: What goes into the blast furnace?
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, Merton Park and John Durst
results.brief_description: The manner in which the raw materials used in a blast furnace - iron ore, coke and limestone - are crushed, blended and otherwise prepared before use in a furnace. Animated diagrams explain the use of a continuous hot air blast.

results.title: What do you mean I've changed?: journeys through post-natal depression
results.brief_description: One in five women suffer from Post-natal depression (PND). In this short documentary, 3 women; Cindy Picton-Barnes, Susan King and Sandi Avery frankly discuss their experiences with PND - the physical and mental symptoms, self-doubt, fear and anxiety, and the treatment they found most effective. Also includes discussion with the womens’ partners and an expert from the Dona Maria Pre and Post-natal Support Network who outlines where women can go for help as well as what factors contribute to PND. Presented by Wendy Harmer, Patron of Dona Maria Post-Natal Support Network.

results.title: What do you know?: screen quiz No. 1
results.brief_description: A humorous film in a slightly slapstick style of a trivia quiz show. Asks such questions as: What is the weight of a dry Australian rules football? Where are a crab’s teeth found? Can a horse sleep standing up? etc. Relevent shots are shown relating to each question and choice answers are provided with a counting down clock. Includes footage of Melbourne, including Swanston and Collins Streets, and a game of Australian Rules football (Carlton vs Collingwood?). Interesting film from an historic point of view. Photography by David J. Bilcock. Written and narrated by Norman Ellis.

results.brief_description: Film stars with a room at the British Public Library and its request systems. Goes on to show old bibles then shows printing for hand bibles of the ‘50s.

results.title: What do I know about Benny?
results.brief_description: Benny is achieving low grades in school and his discipline is poor. His mother discuses the situation with the school principal. The principal attempts to explain that Benny was achieving up to his ability level. The mother rejects this and blames his performance on bad teaching.
